repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: Problem: missing a better way to preview a snippet. Solution: Setting parse_snippet value to item.documentation when completeopt include popup as preview

comment_data.body: Does `vim.bo.filetype` need to be translated to a treesitter parser name, or does it go by vim filetype name? @clason
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -170,6 +170,13 @@ local function get_completion_word(item, prefix, match)
       --
       -- Typing `i` would remove the candidate because newText starts with `t`.
       local text = parse_snippet(item.insertText or item.textEdit.newText)
+      if
+        vim.o.completeopt:find('popup')
+        and #(item.documentation or '') == 0
+        and vim.bo.filetype ~= ''
+      then
+        item.documentation = ('```%s\n%s\n```'):format(vim.bo.filetype, text)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  it('shows snippet source in doc popup if completeopt=popup', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -777,6 +777,32 @@ describe('vim.lsp.completion: item conversion', function()
       eq('hello', text)
     end
   )
+
+  it('when completeopt include popup', function()

comment_data.body: I don't think treesitter is relevant here? But I might be missing context.

comment_data.body: he mean use  something like this `vim.treesitter.language.get_lang(vim.bo.filetype)` to get language as markdown code language identifier instead  just use buffer filetype .

comment_data.body: (of course, the filetype still needs to be registered for a parser if the names doesn't match, but that's also the case for the explicit lookup here)
comment_data.diff_hunk:

@@ -229,9 +251,25 @@ local function get_items(result)
   end
 end
 
----@param item lsp.CompletionItem
----@return string
-local function get_doc(item)
+--- Get documentation for a completion item, enhanced with snippet preview if applicable
+---
+--- @param item lsp.CompletionItem
+--- @param parsed_text string? Optional pre-parsed snippet text
+--- @return string
+local function get_enhanced_doc(item, parsed_text)

comment_regular_data.body:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3bf09598-eff2-4cde-904e-64c66595b9c8)

@glepnir how did you get highlighted content as shown on the screenshot? Does the user have to start treesitter manually there?
I set it manually.. I have implemented the popup preview of lsp and I will submit it later because it involves a C-side fix.
yes, but this will call parse_snippet twice

> yes, but this will call parse_snippet twice

why? can a optional param be added to `get_doc`?

it's more important to group logic in one place, then can optimize it later.
I am confused by the latest changes. Looks like more code, and `get_doc` wasn't re-used.

Why must it be in get_doc? Doesn't **get** mean get? Setting item.document here is not **pure** and does not match the function name. currently returns a new document string instead of modifying the item, so named get_enhanced_doc

It's a local function, in a small scope (one module), meant to capture related logic in one place. Focus on simplifying the logic, ignore the name for now. I can't comment on the name until I see the simplified logic.

title: feat(lsp): completion show snippet preview when popup exist
